alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; St. Bernard; St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 22 at 4:09PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans, St. Bernard and St. Charles. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. Water over some roadways, especially underpasses. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 409 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Metairie, Avondale, Marrero, Harvey, Hahnville, Chalmette, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Elmwood, River Ridge, Waggaman, Bridge City, Ama, St. Rose, Luling, Destrehan and Terrytown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson; Orleans; St. Bernard; St. Charles
